item.dc:creator: @noobie22 Noobie22
item.description:
@noobie22 wrote:

Difficulty: 1/10
Knowledge: C&P
Classes modified: Client class(server side)
Tested on: Delta, but should work for any 317 base.

Okay, first make sure that you have the ring of life already ingame, unfortunately I do not have the models or ints so I can not provide them maybe somebody could get them for me;

Anyways the pieces of code we will be adding is this:

public boolean RingofLife () { if(playerEquipment[playerRing] == 2570 && playerLevel[0] < 11 && inCombat == true) { try { toX = 5656; toY = 6565; sM("Your ring of life saves you from dying! Doing so it shattered!"); playerEquipment[playerRing] = -1; playerEquipmentN[playerRing] = 0; setEquipment(-1, 0,playerRing); } catch (Exception e) { if( playerLevel[0] == 0) { return false; } else return true; } return false; } return true; }

Now lets describe what each piece does;

if(playerEquipment[playerRing] == 2570) && playerLevel[0] < 11

This piece asks if you’re wearing a ring of life and your HP is under 11.

&& inCombat == true) {

This piece makes it so everytime you’re under 11 HP you don’t teleport.

toX = ####; toY = ####;
This tells where you will go after you activated your ring of life.

sM("Your ring of life saves you from dying! Doing so it shattered!")

This piece will send your character message saying that your ring of life

playerEquipment[playerRing] = -1;
playerEquipmentN[playerRing] = 0;
setEquipment(-1, 0,playerRing);[/code]
This tells the server to remove your ring, basically make it dissapear.

[code]} catch (Exception e) { // this makes it possible for the next if statement to be reached
if( playerLevel[0] == 0) { /this makes it so if the players HP is "0" he doesn't teleport away.
return false; // this tells the server to make the ring of life method to not work.
} else // calls back the RoL method
return true; // tells the server to make the RoL method work
} 
return false; //scrap code i needed to add in for errors.
}
return true; // scrap code i needed to add in for errors.
}
